Longitudinal stickiness

Richard Layton

2021-06-25

Source: vignettes/art-06-stickiness.Rmd
art-06-stickiness.Rmd

Introduction

Longitudinal “stickiness” is the ratio of the number of students graduating in a program to the number of students ever enrolled in that program after accounting for the data sufficiency and timely completion criteria [1].

The stickiness metric accounts for all students in a program, including students who begin college part-time, enroll mid-year, switch majors, or transfer. Every student counted in a program’s stickiness metric was enrolled in that program for at least one term. The program succeeded in attracting these students—stickiness tells us how well the program succeeded in retaining them.

Outline

  • Gather eligible students (start with study_programs)
  • Group, summarize, and join enrollees and graduates
  • Condition the findings
  • Compute and graph stickiness (conclude with study_stickiness)

This vignette uses

midfieldr functions

  • filter_match()
  • add_timely_term()
  • add_data_sufficiency()
  • add_race_sex()
  • add_completion_timely()
  • condition_multiway()

packages

# packages used
library("midfieldr")
library("midfielddata")
suppressPackageStartupMessages(library("data.table"))
library("ggplot2")

# optional code to control data.table printing
options(
  datatable.print.nrows = 10,
  datatable.print.topn = 5,
  datatable.print.class = TRUE
)

data

# load data tables from midfielddata
data(student, term, degree)

Gather eligible students

We start with the case study program codes and names saved in the data set study_programs, with which you are familiar from previous vignettes. You may review its help page by running

? study_programs

Review the contents of the saved data:

# Case study programs codes and names 
study_programs
#>       cip6                program
#>     <char>                 <char>
#>  1: 140801      Civil Engineering
#>  2: 140802      Civil Engineering
#>  3: 140803      Civil Engineering
#>  4: 140804      Civil Engineering
#>  5: 140805      Civil Engineering
#> ---                              
#>  8: 141003 Electrical Engineering
#>  9: 141004 Electrical Engineering
#> 10: 141099 Electrical Engineering
#> 11: 141901 Mechanical Engineering
#> 12: 143501 Industrial Engineering

Use filter_match() to subset rows of term by values of cip6 that match values of cip6 in study_programs.

# Get all students in case programs 
DT <- filter_match(term,
  match_to = study_programs,
  by_col = "cip6",
  select = c("mcid", "institution", "cip6")
)

# Retain unique observations
DT <- unique(DT)

# Limit the study to degree-seeking students 
DT <- filter_match(DT,
  match_to = student,
  by_col = "mcid"
)
DT
#>               mcid   institution   cip6
#>             <char>        <char> <char>
#>     1: MID25783178 Institution M 143501
#>     2: MID25783197 Institution M 140801
#>     3: MID25783388 Institution M 141901
#>     4: MID25783441 Institution M 140801
#>     5: MID25783491 Institution M 141001
#>    ---                                 
#> 10760: MID26696967 Institution L 141901
#> 10761: MID26696979 Institution L 141901
#> 10762: MID26697163 Institution L 141901
#> 10763: MID26697444 Institution L 141901
#> 10764: MID26697447 Institution L 141001

# Apply the data sufficiency criterion 
DT <- add_timely_term(DT, midfield_term = term)
DT <- add_data_sufficiency(DT, midfield_term = term)
DT <- DT[data_sufficiency == TRUE]
DT
#>              mcid   institution   cip6 timely_term data_sufficiency
#>            <char>        <char> <char>      <char>           <lgcl>
#>    1: MID25783178 Institution M 143501       20003             TRUE
#>    2: MID25783197 Institution M 140801       19923             TRUE
#>    3: MID25783388 Institution M 141901       19923             TRUE
#>    4: MID25783441 Institution M 140801       19973             TRUE
#>    5: MID25783491 Institution M 141001       20013             TRUE
#>   ---                                                              
#> 8215: MID26696958 Institution L 141901       20163             TRUE
#> 8216: MID26696967 Institution L 141901       20153             TRUE
#> 8217: MID26697163 Institution L 141901       20143             TRUE
#> 8218: MID26697444 Institution L 141901       20153             TRUE
#> 8219: MID26697447 Institution L 141001       20163             TRUE
# Add the grouping variables: program, race, and sex
DT <- merge(DT, study_programs, by = "cip6", all.x = TRUE)
DT <- add_race_sex(DT, midfield_student = student)
DT
#>         cip6        mcid   institution timely_term data_sufficiency
#>       <char>      <char>        <char>      <char>           <lgcl>
#>    1: 140801 MID25783197 Institution M       19923             TRUE
#>    2: 140801 MID25783441 Institution M       19973             TRUE
#>    3: 140801 MID25783553 Institution M       20073             TRUE
#>    4: 140801 MID25784209 Institution M       20003             TRUE
#>    5: 140801 MID25784489 Institution M       19943             TRUE
#>   ---                                                              
#> 8215: 143501 MID26692926 Institution L       20153             TRUE

#> 8217: 143501 MID26695626 Institution L       20143             TRUE
#> 8218: 143501 MID26696116 Institution L       20153             TRUE
#> 8219: 143501 MID26696429 Institution L       20153             TRUE

Group, summarize, and join

Ever enrolled

# Count ever enrolled
ever_enrolled <- DT[, .(ever = .N), by = .(program, race, sex)]
ever_enrolled
#>                    program            race    sex  ever
#>                     <char>          <char> <char> <int>
#>  1:      Civil Engineering           White   Male  1147
#>  2:      Civil Engineering   International   Male    14
#>  3:      Civil Engineering           Asian Female    17
#>  4:      Civil Engineering           White Female   329
#>  5:      Civil Engineering           Black   Male    98
#> ---                                                    
#> 51: Industrial Engineering   Other/Unknown   Male     2
#> 52: Industrial Engineering   International Female     5
#> 53: Industrial Engineering Native American   Male     1
#> 54: Industrial Engineering   Other/Unknown Female     3
#> 55: Industrial Engineering Native American Female     1

Graduates

DT <- add_completion_timely(DT, midfield_degree = degree)

graduates <- DT[completion_timely == TRUE]
graduates
#>         cip6        mcid   institution timely_term data_sufficiency

#>    2: 140801 MID25783441 Institution M       19973             TRUE
#>    3: 140801 MID25784489 Institution M       19943             TRUE

graduates <- graduates[, .(grad = .N), by = .(program, race, sex)]

Join

DT <- merge(ever_enrolled, 
            graduates, 
            by = c("program", "race", "sex"),
            all = TRUE)
DT
#>                    program            race    sex  ever  grad
#>                     <char>          <char> <char> <int> <int>
#>  1:      Civil Engineering           Asian Female    17    12
#>  2:      Civil Engineering           Asian   Male    37    24
#>  3:      Civil Engineering           Black Female    54    28
#>  4:      Civil Engineering           Black   Male    98    43
#>  5:      Civil Engineering Hispanic/Latinx Female    10     5

Condition the results

# Condition
DT[is.na(ever)]
#> Empty data.table (0 rows and 5 cols): program,race,sex,ever,grad
DT[is.na(grad)]
#>                   program            race    sex  ever  grad
#>                    <char>          <char> <char> <int> <int>
#> 1:      Civil Engineering   International Female     1    NA
#> 2: Electrical Engineering Native American Female     3    NA
#> 3: Industrial Engineering Native American   Male     1    NA
#> 4: Industrial Engineering   Other/Unknown   Male     2    NA

DT <- DT[is.na(grad), grad := 0]

sort(unique(DT$ever))
#>  [1]    1    2    3    5    6    7    8   10   11   14   16   17   22   23   25
#> [16]   28   37   38   40   48   54   56   60   67   71   76   83   94   98  106
#> [31]  122  154  193  197  214  234  291  304  329  494 1147 1366 1940
sort(unique(DT$grad))
#>  [1]    0    1    3    4    5    6    7    8   10   12   14   19   20   22   24
#> [16]   27   28   33   37   38   42   43   46   47   55   57   77   95  100  122
#> [31]  127  137  142  195  232  321  783  870 1265
sort(unique(DT$race))
#> [1] "Asian"           "Black"           "Hispanic/Latinx" "International"  
#> [5] "Native American" "Other/Unknown"   "White"
sort(unique(DT$sex))
#> [1] "Female" "Male"



DT <- DT[ever > 10]
DT <- DT[race %chin% c("Asian", "Black", "Hispanic/Latinx", "Native American", "White" )]



sort(unique(DT$ever))
#>  [1]   11   14   17   23   25   37   38   40   54   56   60   67   76   83   94
#> [16]   98  106  122  154  193  197  214  234  291  304  329  494 1147 1366 1940
sort(unique(DT$grad))
#>  [1]    8   10   12   19   20   22   24   27   28   33   37   38   43   46   47
#> [16]   55   57   77   95  100  122  127  137  142  195  232  321  783  870 1265
sort(unique(DT$race))
#> [1] "Asian"           "Black"           "Hispanic/Latinx" "Native American"
#> [5] "White"
sort(unique(DT$sex))
#> [1] "Female" "Male"

Compute stickiness

Expect 40 rows

# stickiness
options(datatable.print.topn = 40)
DT[, stick := round(100 * grad / ever, 1)]
DT <- DT[order(program, sex, race)]



DT[, race_sex := paste(race, sex)]
DT <- DT[, .(program, race_sex, ever, grad, stick)]
DT
#>                    program               race_sex  ever  grad stick
#>                     <char>                 <char> <int> <int> <num>
#>  1:      Civil Engineering           Asian Female    17    12  70.6
#>  2:      Civil Engineering           Black Female    54    28  51.9
#>  3:      Civil Engineering           White Female   329   232  70.5

Same as built-in data study_stickiness.

all.equal(case_stickiness, study_stickiness)
#> [1] TRUE
# data preparation
DT <- condition_multiway(case_stickiness)
DT_med <- condition_multiway(DT, details = TRUE)

Graph the results

# creating a multiway graph
ggplot(data = DT_med, aes(x = stick, y = race_sex)) +
  facet_wrap(vars(program), ncol = 1, as.table = FALSE) +
  geom_vline(aes(xintercept = med_program),
    linetype = 2
  ) +
  geom_point(na.rm = TRUE) +
  labs(
    x = "Stickiness",
    y = "",
    title = "Practice data (not for research)",
    caption = "Source: midfielddata"
  )

References

[1]
M. Ohland, M. Orr, R. Layton, S. Lord, and R. Long, “Introducing stickiness as a versatile metric of engineering persistence,” in Proceedings of the Frontiers in Education Conference, 2012, pp. 1–5.

Appendix

Complete script

The vignette code chunks are collected below in a single, condensed script.

# packages used
library("midfieldr")
library("midfielddata")
library("data.table")
library("ggplot2")
